column1: All of the following answers are true EXCEPT: Microtubules can be localized:
column8:
Correct: C
Key idea: Microvilli are actin-based, not microtubule-based.
  • Microvilli: core bundle of actin filaments anchored in the terminal web (increase surface area).
  • Cilia/flagella: axoneme built from microtubules (classically 9+2; primary cilium 9+0).
  • Centrosome: main microtubule-organizing center (MTOC).
Exam trap: confuse microvilli (actin) with cilia (microtubules).

  • NPC function: selective transport (proteins into nucleus; mRNA/ribosomal subunits out).

Why: Cartilage with many chondrocytes in lacunae plus a conspicuous network of elastic fibers in the matrix.

column1: The process of compaction of the pre-embryo leads to a formation of outer and inner cell mass, which differ in their intercellular junctions as follows:
column2: Outer cell mass – tight junctions, inner cell mass – gap junctions
column3: Outer cell mass – adherent junctions, inner cell mass – desmosomes
column4: Outer cell mass – gap junctions, inner cell mass – tight junctions
column5: Outer cell mass – desmosomes, inner cell mass – adherent junctions
column6: Outer cell mass – hemidesmosomes, inner cell mass – desmosomes
column8:
Correct: A
Core concept: During compaction (around the 8-cell stage), the outer cells become epithelial-like and must form a seal to allow blastocoel formation.
  • Outer cell mass (trophoblast lineage): enriched in tight junctions → barrier to prevent fluid leakage.
  • Inner cell mass (embryoblast): enriched in gap junctions → cell-cell communication and coordination of fate.
  • Hemidesmosomes: anchor cells to basal lamina—not the key junction here.

column1: The amniotic and yolk sac cavities are temporarily connected by:
column8:
Correct: A
Why: During gastrulation, a transient communication can exist between amniotic cavity and yolk sac via the neurenteric canal (through the primitive pit).
  • Allantois: diverticulum from yolk sac involved in early bladder/umbilical region—not a direct amnion–yolk sac connector.
  • Trophoblast/cytotrophoblast: placental tissues, not cavity connectors.
Exam anchor: “temporary connection amnion ↔ yolk sac” → neurenteric canal.
